Owen_Riegling:
{{short description|Canadian country singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Owen Riegling | image = Owen Riegling.jpg | caption = Riegling performing in 2022 | image_size = | background = solo_singer | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1998}} | birth_name = | birth_place = | alias = | origin = [[Mildmay, Ontario]], Canada | instrument = Guitar, vocals | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country rock]]|[[Neotraditional country|traditional country]]}} | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2019–present | label = [[Universal Music Canada]] | website = {{official|https://www.owenriegling.com/}} }} '''Owen Michael Riegling''' is a Canadian [[country music]] singer and songwriter. He is currently signed to [[Universal Music Canada]], and has charted with the singles "Love (The Sweater Song)", "[[Old Dirt Roads]]", and "Moonshines". ==Early life== Riegling grew up on a 100-acre farm in [[Mildmay, Ontario]].{{cite web|url=https://cmaontario.ca/artist-of-the-month-owen-riegling-may-2022/|title=Artist of the Month: Owen Riegling|date=May 10, 2022|work=CMA Ontario|access-date=December 25, 2023}} He began playing the guitar at eleven years old, after receiving one as a Christmas gift.{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/owen-riegling-interview/|title=Owen Riegling Talks About Music and New Single|date=September 15, 2019|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=December 25, 2023}} He performed for the first time as part of his guitar teacher's band (Country Indie Artist Tattoos 'N Whiskey), before progressing to play covers of [[Eric Church]] songs at local venues. Riegling initially attended business school after high school, but realized he enjoyed playing music more. He elected to attend the [[Ontario Institute of Audio Recording Technology]] for music production, after he had won a free recording session in a contest. ==Career== In July 2019, Riegling independently released the song "Smoke Man". The song was included on his debut extended play ''Empty Room'', which was released on September 4, 2020.{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/owen-riegling-ep-empty-room/|title=Owen Riegling's Debut EP ''Empty Room'' Drops Today|date=September 4, 2020|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=December 25, 2023}} In August 2022, Riegling won the [[Boots and Hearts]] Emerging Artist Showcase contest, securing him a single release with [[Universal Music Canada]], songwriting sessions, and a trip to [[Nashville]].{{cite web|url=https://theranch100.com/mildmays-owen-riegling-wins-emerging-artist-showcase-at-boots-hearts/|title=Mildmay's Owen Riegling wins Emerging Artist Showcase at Boots & Hearts|work=100.1 FM The Ranch|date=August 8, 2022|access-date=December 25, 2023}}{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/owen-riegling-wins-boots-hearts-emerging-artist/|title=Owen Riegling Wins The 2022 Boots & Hearts Emerging Artist Showcase|date=August 7, 2022|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=December 25, 2023}}{{cite web|url=https://www.excal.on.ca/arts/2023/11/07/owen-riegling-small-town-country-music-star/|title=Owen Riegling: Small-town country music star|date=November 7, 2023|first=Kaila|last=Gallacher|work=Excalibur|access-date=December 25, 2023}} In June 2023, Riegling signed a record deal with [[Universal Music Canada]] and released his debut radio single "Love (The Sweater Song)".{{cite web|url=https://www.universalmusic.ca/press-releases/owen-riegling-signs-with-universal-music-canada-and-kicks-off-summer-with-new-single-love-the-sweater-song/|title=Owen Riegling Signs with Universal Music Canada and Kicks Off Summer with New Single "Love (The Sweater Song)"|date=June 23, 2023|work=[[Universal Music Canada]]|access-date=December 25, 2023}}{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/owen-riegling-universal-music-deal-debut-single-love-the-sweater-song/|title=Owen Riegling Signs with Universal Music Canada and Releases Debut Single "Love (The Sweater Song)"|date=June 23, 2023|first=Logan|last=Miller|work=Front Porch Music|access-date=December 25, 2023}} He was also nominated for "Rising Star" at the CMA Ontario Awards.{{cite web|url=https://www.pentictonherald.ca/spare_news/article_411cb3b8-4b60-509b-aad1-3c80087bc3c1.html|title=Mildmay's Owen Riegling nominated for CMAOntario Rising Star Award|first=Pauline|last=Kerr|date=June 2, 2023|work=[[Penticton Herald]]|access-date=December 25, 2023}} In August 2023, Riegling released the song "[[Old Dirt Roads]]", which later became his second single at Canadian country radio.{{cite web|url=https://www.universalmusic.ca/press-releases/owen-riegling-releases-second-single-old-dirt-roads-out-today/|title=Owen Riegling Releases Second Single "Old Dirt Roads" Out Today|date=August 10, 2023|work=[[Universal Music Canada]]|access-date=December 25, 2023}}{{cite web|url=https://frontporchmusic.ca/old-dirt-roads-owen-riegling/|title=On "Old Dirt Roads" Owen Riegling Gets Down to Earth|first=Taylor|last=Preston|work=Front Porch Music|date=September 8, 2023|access-date=December 25, 2023}}{{cite web|url=https://www.rfdtv.com/rising-canadian-country-music-artist-owen-riegling-discusses-his-success-and-performs-his-latest-single|title=Rising Canadian country music artist Owen Riegling discusses his success and performs his latest single|date=November 10, 2023|first=Currey|last=McCullough|work=[[RFD-TV]]|access-date=December 25, 2023}} In October 2023, he was an opening act for American country artist [[Tyler Hubbard]] on his solo headlining tour in Canada.{{cite web|url=https://www.country933.com/2023/08/08/one-to-watch-owen-riegling/|title=One to Watch: OWEN RIEGLING|first=Nicolina|last=Moscati|work=Country 93.3|date=August 8, 2023|access-date=December 25, 2023}} Later that fall, Riegling joined [[Robyn Ottolini]] as the opening act for the Canadian dates on her "All My Friends Are Hot Tour".{{cite web|url= https://www.soundcheckentertainment.ca/robyn-ottolini-announces-the-all-my-friends-are-hot-north-american-tour/|title=Robyn Ottolini Announces the 'All My Friends Are Hot' North American Tour|date=September 12, 2023|first=Hendrik|last=Pape|work=Sound Check Entertainment|access-date=December 25, 2023}} In 2024, he joined [[Chase Rice]]'s "Get Western Tour" as an opening act for most of the Canadian dates.{{cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2023/11/chase-rice-to-head-up-north-for-get-western-tour/|title=Chase Rice To Head Up North For 'Get Western Tour'|date=November 22, 2023|first=Lorie|last=Hollabaugh|work=Music Row|access-date=December 25, 2023}} On May 24, 2024, Riegling released the extended play ''Bruce County''.{{cite web|url=https://www.kx947.fm/index.php/melissa-s-country-news/4754-owen-riegling-announces-his-debut-ep|title=Owen Riegling Announces His Debut EP|work=KX 94.7 FM|access-date=May 20, 2024}} He was nominated in four categories at the [[2024 Canadian Country Music Awards]], and won Breakthrough Artist of the Year and Songwriter of the Year.{{cite web|url=https://ca.billboard.com/music/country/ccma-nominations-2024|title=Canadian Country Music Association Awards 2024 Nominations: Jade Eagleson, MacKenzie Porter Lead The Pack|first=Kerry|last=Doole|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] Canada|access-date=September 11, 2024|date=July 18, 2024}}{{cite web|url=https://ccma.org/2024-ccma-award-nominees/|title=2024 CCMA Award Nominees|access-date=September 11, 2024|work=[[Canadian Country Music Association]]}}{{cite web|url=https://ccma.org/2024-ccma-award-winners/|title=2024 CCMA Award Winners|work=[[Canadian Country Music Association]]|access-date=September 15, 2024|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20240915175950/https://ccma.org/2024-ccma-award-winners/|archive-date=September 15, 2024}} ==Tours==
